required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimizing the Assessment of Refractive Outcomes After Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Optimizing the Assessment of Refractive Outcomes After Cataract Surgery and Implantation of a Monofocal Intraocular Lens (IOL)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate current available assessments (automated vs. manual) with which manifest refraction data and biometric variables are obtained to understand if data from an automated refractor can be utilized to optimize the A-constant as well as manual subjective refraction (ie, to a clinically insignificant difference). The A-constant is the calculated number that helps the surgeon determine which IOL should be implanted in the eye during cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will be implanted with ACRYSOF® IQ Monofocal IOL Model SN60WF. Standard clinical practice will be followed for pre-operative testing, IOL power estimation and IOL implantation. Only one eye will be enrolled in the study per surgeon determination. The eye will undergo both an automated and manual manifest refraction assessment at 3 months postoperative.

primary_outcome.measure: IOL A-constant with manifest spherical equivalent refraction at 3 months
IOL A-constant with spherical equivalent from autorefraction at 3 months

arm_group.description: Manifest refraction performed by autorefraction (automated) and manual procedures (standard). Participant implanted with ACRYSOF® IQ Monofocal IOL Model SN60WF. Autorefraction performed by Topcon® KR-1W Wave-Front Analyzer.

intervention.description: Manifest refraction performed by autorefraction (automated) and manual procedures (standard)

intervention.intervention_name: ACRYSOF® IQ Monofocal IOL Model SN60WF
intervention.description: Monofocal IOL implanted for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract patient
Wavefront and topography system used to obtain autorefraction data

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations
